snippet: His version of “The Last Supper” sold for $23.3 million. How does Mr. Zeng explain his success? “I only sell my paintings to those who really like them.”...
abstract: Saturday Profile of Zeng Fanzhi, painter at forefront of China's rising art scene; canny approach to gathering collectors combined with indisputable painting skills have driven Zeng to top and brought $23.3 million auction price in 2013 for his work The Last Supper.

byline.contributor: Emily Feng and Yufan Huang contributed research.

lead_paragraph: His version of “The Last Supper” sold for $23.3 million. How does Mr. Zeng explain his success? “I only sell my paintings to those who really like them.”

headline.print_headline: How a Poor Student Rebelled to Become China’s Hottest Artist
headline.main: How Zeng Fanzhi Became China’s Hottest Artist, and Why His Lawn Is So Green

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Ullens Center for Contemporary Art (Beijing, China)
